get.description: Retrieve the current user's activity feed with optional filtering

parameters.name: not_seen_yet
parameters.description: Filter to show only unseen activities (1 for true, 0 for false)

parameters.name: show_archive
parameters.description: Include archived activities (1 for true, 0 for false)

id.description: Unique identifier for the activity feed item

seen.description: Whether the user has seen this activity

created_at.description: When the activity feed item was created

type.description: Type of entity this activity relates to

message_key.description: Translation key for the activity message

created_at.description: When the activity was created

object.description: Activity context object containing related entities and metadata

count.description: Number of items in current response

post.description: Retrieve a filtered list of approvals using POST method for complex filtering. This endpoint uses POST instead of GET to support complex filter criteria in the request body. Response excludes mockup arrays for performance.

requestBody.description: Filter and sort criteria for approval list. Omit filters and sort arrays if empty to avoid 422 errors.

filters.description: Array of filter conditions (omit if empty to avoid 422 error)

sort.description: Array of sort conditions (omit if empty to avoid 422 error)

type.description: Type of approval - either job-level or order-level

approved_by.description: Who approved the approval - user or customer

job_id.description: Associated job ID (only present when type=job)

job_scoped_id.description: Job scoped identifier (only present when type=job)

job_name.description: Job display name (only present when type=job)

order_quote.description: Whether the associated order is a quote

approved_by_user.description: User who approved the approval (null if not yet approved by user)

completed_at.description: Completion timestamp in UTC ISO 8601 format (null if not completed) (e.g., 2023-12-25T10:30:00.000Z)

created_at.description: Creation timestamp in UTC ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2023-12-25T10:30:00.000Z)

customer_last_viewed_date.description: Last time customer viewed this approval in UTC ISO 8601 format (null if never viewed) (e.g., 2023-12-25T10:30:00.000Z)

notes_from_customer.description: Feedback or notes provided by the customer (null or empty string if no notes provided)

notes_to_customer.description: Instructions or notes provided to the customer (can be empty string)

signature.description: Customer signature data (null if not signed yet)

data.description: Array of approval items (without mockup array for performance)

count.description: Number of items in current response

post.description: Uploads a file asynchronously and returns an upload ID that can be used to attach the file to entities (sales orders, jobs, purchase orders, etc.) in subsequent API calls

parameters.description: Team identifier for context-aware file upload

requestBody.description: File upload with collection type specification

collection.description: Upload collection type specifying the intended use of the file before entity attachment

media.description: File to be uploaded asynchronously for later attachment to entities

default_collection.description: Upload a file to the default collection for general use

mockup_collection.description: Upload a mockup file for design review purposes

production_file.description: Upload a production-ready file for manufacturing

200.description: File uploaded successfully with upload ID for entity attachment

collection.description: Collection type the media belongs to

mime_type.description: MIME type of the uploaded file

is_image.description: Whether the uploaded file is an image

show_in_pdf.description: Whether to show this media in PDF exports

file_name.description: Original filename of the uploaded file

url.description: Direct URL to access the file

view_url.description: URL for viewing the file in browser

preview.description: Preview image URLs in different sizes (only for image files)

position.description: Position/order of the media in collections

delete.description: Removes an uploaded file by its upload ID before it has been attached to any entities. Once a file is attached to an entity, it should be removed through the entity-specific media endpoints.

parameters.name: teamSlug
parameters.description: Team identifier for context-aware file removal

parameters.name: upload_id
parameters.description: Upload identifier to remove (obtained from upload response)

data.description: Whether the upload was successfully removed

success.description: Whether the removal request was successful

already_removed.description: File upload was already removed or did not exist

post.description: Calculate tax rate for a customer and address

Analyzes a barcode value to identify the entity type, ID, and hierarchical relationships within the YoPrint system. Note: Only pass the barcode identifier (e.g., "y9-0p-job-1584"), not the full URL. If you have a URL like "https://ypnt.us/qrt/y9-0p-job-1584", extract only the last segment after the final slash.

parameters.name: teamSlug
parameters.description: Team identifier for context-aware barcode decoding

requestBody.description: Barcode identifier to decode (not the full URL)

value.description: Barcode identifier to decode (e.g., "y9-0p-job-1584"). Do not include the full URL - extract only the barcode portion after the last slash if you have a URL like "https://ypnt.us/qrt/y9-0p-job-1584".

type.description: Identified entity type from barcode analysis

id.description: Unique identifier of the decoded entity

parent.description: Optional parent entity in hierarchical relationship (e.g., job parent is sales order)

get.summary: Get unique identifier for a specified document
get.description: Generates a unique identifier for a specified type of document

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specifies the document type for which a unique scoped_id will be generated with corresponding prefix

schema.description: Available types: sales_order (SO prefix), quote (QT prefix), purchase_order (PO prefix), stock_adjustment (SA prefix), stock_transfer (ST prefix), defect (DF prefix)

success.description: Indicates if the request was successful

post.description: Validates an Elasticsearch query string syntax before execution. The endpoint takes the query string from the "search" parameter, passes it to Elasticsearch's validateQuery API to check if the query syntax is valid, and returns success (200) if valid or error (422) if invalid. This pre-validation prevents runtime errors, provides immediate feedback on syntax errors, and ensures queries are properly formatted for operators like AND, OR, NOT, field searches, wildcards, and range queries.

search.description: The Elasticsearch query string to validate. Supports query syntax including boolean operators (AND, OR, NOT), field searches (field:value), wildcards (*), phrase searches ("exact phrase"), range queries ([min TO max]), and parentheses for grouping. Example: "status:active AND (priority:high OR priority:critical)"

data.description: No data returned, validation is indicated by success

success.description: Indicates if the query is valid
